definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: There are no interjections when he speaks.
sentences.chinese: 他的话语中从来没有感叹词。

sentences.english: Most of these exclamations have survived from earlier days.
sentences.chinese: 大多数从早期流传下来的感叹词。

sentences.english: The first one is to discuss the beginning of Interjection.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要讨论感叹词的产生。

sentences.english: Other popular exclamations combine holy with other words.
sentences.chinese: 其他流行的感叹词将holy与其他词结合起来。

sentences.english: In this case, the product's properties are an interjection and a noun .
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，产品的属性是一个感叹词的一个名词。

sentences.english: The second chapter discussed the problem of defining an interjection.
sentences.chinese: 第二章主要讨论有关感叹词的界定问题。

definition: form word/in Classical Chinese, the first character of phrase having auxiliary grammatical function
word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
